{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2018}} {{Use Indian English|date=October 2018}} {{refimprove|date=December 2011}} {{Infobox settlement | name = Bilimora | native_name = | native_name_lang = | other_name = | nickname = | settlement_type = city | image_skyline = | image_alt = | image_caption = | pushpin_map = India Gujarat#India | pushpin_label_position = right | pushpin_map_alt = | pushpin_map_caption = Location in Gujarat, India | coordinates = {{coord|20.75|N|72.95|E|display=inline,title}} | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = {{flag|India}} | subdivision_type1 = [[States and territories of India|State]] | subdivision_name1 = [[Gujarat]] | subdivision_type2 = [[List of districts of India|District]] | subdivision_name2 = [[Navsari district|Navsari]] | established_title = <!-- Established --> | established_date = | founder = | named_for = | government_type = | governing_body = | unit_pref = Metric | area_footnotes = | area_rank = | area_total_km2 = 9 | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = 4 | population_total = 57583 | population_as_of = 2001 | population_rank = 62nd in Gujarat | population_density_km2 = auto | population_demonym = | population_footnotes = | demographics_type1 = Languages | demographics1_title1 = Official | demographics1_info1 = [[Gujarati language|Gujarati]], [[Hindi language|Hindi]] | timezone1 = [[Indian Standard Time|IST]] | utc_offset1 = +5:30 | postal_code_type = [[Postal Index Number|PIN]] | postal_code = 396321 | area_code_type = Telephone code | area_code = 02634 | registration_plate = GJ 21 | sex_ratio = | website = [http://www.bilimoranagarpalika.net] | footnotes = }} '''Bilimora''' is a city situated on the banks of the river [[Ambika River|Ambika]], in [[Gandevi]] taluka and [[Navsari district]] of [[Gujarat]] state in [[India]]. The city comes under the purview of the [[Surat Metropolitan Region]]. The city is roughly {{convert|70|km|mi}} south of the city of Surat and is the southernmost point of the Surat Metropolitan Region and the Metropolis of [[Surat]]. It is linked to Surat by [[State Highway (India)|SH]] 6 and [[State Highway (India)|SH]] 88.{{clarify|date=December 2011}}
In the late 18th century, the [[Baroda State]] established a naval station at Bilimora, a port about {{convert|40|mi|km}} south of Surat, known as ''Bunder Bilimora Suba Armor''. A fleet of 50 vessels was stationed here, mostly sailboats, cargo vessels for trading and military vessels to secure the sea from the [[Portugal|Portuguese]], the [[Netherlands|Dutch]] and the [[France|French]].<ref name="it">{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-09-27/vadodara/28212949_1_vessels-erstwhile-baroda-state-passports|title=280 years ago, Baroda had its own Navy|date=27 September 2010|work=The Times of India}}</ref>
== Geography == Bilimora is located at {{coord|20.75|N|72.95|E|}}.<ref>[http://www.fallingrain.com/world/IN/9/Bilimora.html Falling Rain Genomics, Inc - Bilimora]</ref> It has an average elevation of {{convert|4|m|ft}}. Bilimora is the second largest city in the [[Navsari district]] after [[Navsari]] city. The city is supposed to have been surrounded by three rivers: Ambica from the north, Kaveri River from the south, and Karera River passes close by.
== People and culture == Most of the population is of [[Gujarati people|Gujarati]], [[Marathi people|Marathi]] and other North Indian states particularly that of Uttar Pradesh and Bihar.
There were also a lot of [[Parsi]] in the town; now the Parsi population is not that significant, however there is still a street called 'Agiyari Mahollo' inhabited by [[Parsi]].
Also, a large number of the Sikh community which were stationed there as part of a refugee camp during partition remain in Bilimora. Although Bilimora is situated in the state of Gujarat, it has a lot of cultural influence from [[Mumbai]] which is around 220 km away. It takes 3 hours by train and 4 hours by road to reach Mumbai from Bilimora.
== Transport == Bilimora is well connected through rail, road and sea. It takes 3 hours maximum by train and 3 to 4 hours by road from Mumbai. The closest domestic airport is at Surat and the nearest international airport is at Mumbai.
[[Bilimora railway station|Bilimora]] is the only rail junction in the [[Mumbai]] division line of the [[Western Railway Zone (India)|Western Railway]] ([[India]]), from which a narrow gauge line separates from the broad line to arrive at [[Waghai]] in the [[Dang District, India|Dang]] District. It is said to be that this narrow gauge line is to be converted into broad gauge and will be extended up to [[Manmad]]. Bilimora will be well connected through [[Maharashtra]]; the survey has been done and the project is to be evaluated for estimate. The town of [[Chikhli, Gujarat|Chikhli]] is about 10 km to the east, which is on [[National Highway 8 (India)|National Highway 8]].
It is directly connected to [[Saputara]] - a hill station in Gujarat - by bus. The buses come from Bilimora and also from Surat to Nasik or Pune via Bilimora - [[Saputara]].
The town is about 25 km north of the city of [[Valsad]] and about 25 km south of the district headquarters [[Navsari]].
==Banks & ATM== Bilimora has all major banks, including:Dena Bank, Bank Of Baroda, Federal Bank, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, IDBI Bank , IOB, Punjab National Bank, State Bank Of India and the Union Bank of India. There is also one People Bank in Bilimora's name as Gandevi People's Bank. ATM's from these major banks are available in Bilimora.
==Popular places== Bilimora is a small city with lot of temples, such as Shri Jalaram Mandir, Shri Gayatri Mandir, Shri Dwarkadhish Mandir, Swaminarayan Mandir, Ganga Mata Temple, Shri Ramji Mandir (at Talodh), Somnath Mahadev Mandir and a Sikh Gurudwara on Gandevi Road. The new inclusion is Sai Mandir on Somnath Road.
'''Saputara and Dang District Tourism:''' [[Saputara]], the only hill station in Gujarat, is around 110 km away from Bilimora. One can visit [[Waghai]], [[Saputara]], Gira Falls in [[Dang District, India]] via a one day road trip from Bilimora.
Unai Hot Springs is another popular place. Many local people believe in the Legend of Sri Ram which is linked to the hot springs. Unai is about 40 km from Bilimora. The nearest railway station is [[Waghai]]. The narrow gauge rail link connecting [[Ahwa]] to Bilimora runs through the park.
